title: How Global Value Chains can change Sri Lanka's trade strategy for the better

title: Kandy Esala Perahera livestreamed globally
snippet: The Kandy Esala Perahera is the culmination of over 1,700 years of history, tradition, and artisanship and during the annual event, the citadel of Kandy comes alive in a breathtaking pageant of sound and illumination.

title: DIMO and Komatsu mark 50 years of transforming Sri Lanka through world-class heavy machinery
snippet: DIMO, one of the leading conglomerates in Sri Lanka, is celebrating its partnership of 50 years with the world-renowned heavy machinery giant Komatsu in the country at the same time that Komatsu is marking 100 years of its business operations.

title: Govt. to call tenders for mid-to-large scale solar and wind power plants
snippet: As the government officially adopted the policy to meet 70 percent of the country's electricity generation from renewable energy sources by 2030, the Cabinet nod has been given to call for proposals of Expression of Interests (EOIs) for solar and wind power projects from interested local and foreign investors.

title: Government approves US$ 783mn export-oriented aloe vera-based herbal medicine project
snippet: The government has approved a US$ 783 million aloe vera -based herbal medicine manufacturing project titled 'Dry Zone Rural Economic Development Aloe Vera Project' in the Anuradhapura District targeting exports.

title: Sri Lanka can gain a myriad of benefits from twinning floating solar and hydropower
snippet: Sri Lanka needs to add an estimated 11,000 MW to its power grid within the next two decades to meet the growing demand. Adding large-scale floating solar plants would not only make electricity greener and affordable but also improves Sri Lanka's overall economic competitiveness as well.

title: SL to get US$ 92mn from IBRD to improve weather and climate forecasting
snippet: The Cabinet nod has been finally given to enter into an agreement with the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD) of the World Bank (WB) to secure US$ 92 million funding for the phase one of revised Climate Resilience Multi-Phase Programmatic Approach projects.

title: Govt. prepares for austerity measures; no decision on IMF assistance yet
snippet: Although the government is yet to reach a definite decision whether to go to the International Monetary Fund (IMF) or not, it has begun preparations for austerity measures such as freezing new recruitments and restructuring welfare programmes in order to curtail government expenditure in the upcoming budget 2022 amid a narrowing fiscal path.
